body: @iSazonov @vexx32 can you two please take a look?  Need a second eye as I can't find my mistake.
First we need confirmation from @TravisEz13 - I am not sure that it is right direction for spelling.
@iSazonov see issue #8078

I love pester ü§£ 
```
Context Verify spelling in /home/vsts/work/1/s/tools/performance/README.md
      [-] >> 8 spelling errors found in 1 file should work 2ms
        RuntimeException: Tool reported spelling as wrong.
```

Does `mdspell` allow us to see each spelling error @RDIL?

Might need to rethink how you're categorising and parsing the output üòâ
Yeah it does but I sadly don't have that level of expertise in powershell :(
Thank you for all your help @vexx32!
@rdil can you show me some example output from mdspell? I can probably figure out a regex to get the misspelled words.

@vexx32 here:
https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5949319808024576
make sure to click on main to open the logs
also its at the very bottom of logs

Ah, I see. So currently you're checking your final output line, the summary. OK... OK... hm. Can you mock up an example where there's spelling errors in at least two files for me? I can definitely regex that, just don't wanna miss anything. ‚ù§Ô∏è 

I'm guessing that you can safely assume that if there's more than one line of output there were spelling errors. The rest would just be getting the file name and misspelled word(s).
sure one min

@vexx32 here is with 2 files:
https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5078643473645568
@vexx32 nice.  I'll try to add it whenever I have time.
i give up these spelling errors cannot be fixed
@RDIL if you work in the code to parse the output more granularly it should point you right to each error, instead of you having to scan through each file to figure out what's going wrong üòÑ
@vexx32 I'm aware of which sentence the errors are in, but I don't know which word.
List the remaining lines here, then, I guess?

This looks like a good start.  It would be nice if we could use this version of the tool (https://github.com/lukeapage/node-markdown-spellcheck/pull/114) so that pester could parse the results and report the actual line and word that failed.
Sorry, I didn't read @vexx32 	's comments. Before posting that, just consider it as one idea.
I'm going to close this until I am in a better mental state and can work on this.

@web-flow, your last commit had 3 failures in `PowerShell-CI-static-analysis`

It says it somewhere in the static analysis results


It looks like the file overrides in .spelling don't work like they're supposed to. If I remove the file override lines and just put everything in the global dictionary, it works fine.
Interesting, I‚Äôll give it a look.
Umm it didn‚Äôt work üò¢
Next to the line number there should be a clickable space which gives you the ability to type in a message
Holy cow it worked
@iSazonov are you sure removing the throw is the right thing? That would make the tests pass...
@RDIL My request is not remove throw but replace with Should - I'd expect more friendly output. I can wrong but you could make tests and compare the output.
I'm sorry, but I don't really understand what you mean by that.
@RDIL I haven't experience to review this in depth. And MSFT team is busy in the days :-( So waiting...
